title: Mary Earps - Wikipedia
snippet: She and Paris Saint-Germain lost 5–2 on aggregate to Juventus in the 2024–25 UEFA Women's Champions League qualifying rounds. On 12 November 2025, Earps returned to Manchester United in the Champions League for the first time since her move, where they lost 2-1.

title: England Women's player profile: Mary Earps | England Football
snippet: After five years at Old Trafford and helping the club to their first ever Women's FA Cup title in 2024, Mary took on a new challenge by joining French giants Paris Saint-Germain. Earps called time on her spell with the Lionesses in May 2025, after collecting a total of 53 caps.

title: Mary Earps details emerge after Lionesses legend snubbed invite from FA following retirement announcement
snippet: Earps currently plays her club football for Paris Saint-Germain.

title: Women's EURO champion Mary Earps announces retirement from international football
snippet: The 32-year-old, who plays her club football in France for Paris Saint-Germain, was named goalkeeper of the tournament at both the UEFA Women's EURO 2022 tournament, which England won on home soil, as well as the 2023 FIFA Women's World Cup, ...

title: England goalkeeper Mary Earps retires ahead of 2025 Euros in shock announcement
snippet: Although she is retiring from international football, Mary Earps will still play club football, after joining Paris Saint-Germain from Manchester United last year. The UEFA Women’s Euro 2025 tournament will be played in Switzerland from 2 ...
